channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Forget benefits for humans—these are the pet perks that employees are clamoring for
item.description: When it comes to pets, offering a few basic benefits could bring employees peace of mind.

item.title: Dozens Are Killed in an Israeli Strike in North Gaza, Local Authorities say
item.description: Gaza’s health ministry said that at least 25 children were among those killed in an Israeli strike on a residential building in Beit Lahia, in norther...

item.title: NIL superstar Livvy Dunne inks her first deal with an equity stake—and says she’d love her own brand one day
item.description: The LSU gymnast is competing for a fifth and final year, with an eye on what comes after college.

item.title: Trump Betrayed America.Republicans Must Put Country Above Party.
item.description: The time has come for my fellow Republicans to put country above party.

item.title: Biden to announce $3bn in grants to electrify U.S. ports and cut carbon emissions during visit to Baltimore
item.description: The Maryland port is among 55 ports across 27 states and territories that will receive nearly $3 billion through the Clean Ports Program administered ...

item.title: Boston pizzeria owner convicted of forced labor and sentenced to 8.5 years after threatening his workers with deportation
item.description: Papantoniadis forced or attempted to force six victims — five men and one woman — to work for him and comply with excessive workplace demands.

item.title: Live Updates: Dozens Killed in Israeli Strike in Northern Gaza, Palestinian Officials Say
item.description: The Israeli military said it was looking into reports of the attack. The Palestinian Civil Defense, an emergency service, said at least 55 people were...

item.title: Houthi Arrests of Yemenis on Spying Charges Alarm Diplomats and Aid Workers
item.description: The Iran-backed Houthi militia has detained dozens of Yemenis linked to the U.S. Embassy or international organizations recently.

item.title: Amid Climate Crisis, Svalbard Global Seed Vault Gets a Huge Deposit
item.description: A storage facility in Norway built to safeguard crop diversity recently received more than 30,000 samples as concerns grow about climate change and fo...

item.title: What Giuliani Is Losing: The Co-op. The Yankees Swag. The Convertible.
item.description: The trappings of Rudolph W. Giuliani’s New York life are slipping away to pay $148 million to two election workers who sued for defamation.

item.title: Stephen Bannon, Released From Prison, Says He Is ‘Empowered’
item.description: Mr. Bannon, the combative right-wing strategist, said if Trump’s vote totals on Election Day look like 2020, he should once again declare himself the ...

item.title: Ethereum giant Consensys slashes workforce by 20% as CEO blames ‘abuse of power’ by SEC
item.description: Founder Joe Lubin said ongoing legal troubles with the SEC are costing millions of dollars, and resulting in job losses.

item.title: Jon Stewart Fears Madison Square Garden Will Never Be the Same
item.description: After Donald Trump’s rally, Stewart showed an image of Billy Joel and asked, “How dare they desecrate the stage that the Piano Man has consecrated?”

item.title: The Game Theory of Democracy
item.description: All around the world, leaders are exploiting legal and electoral systems in an attempt to win more power. What does it take to beat them?

item.description: All around the world, leaders are exploiting legal and electoral systems in an attempt to win more power. What does it take to beat them?
